Documentation¶

class reamber.base.lists.TimedList.TimedList(*args)¶

A class to handle all derives’ offset-related functions.

All derived class must inherit from a list of their singular type

addOffset(by: float, inplace: bool = False) → reamber.base.lists.TimedList.TimedList¶

Adds offset to all object

Parameters

  • by – The offset to move by

  • inplace – Whether to just modify this instance or return a modified copy

Returns

Returns a modified copy if not inplace

after(offset: float, includeEnd: bool = False, inplace: bool = False) → reamber.base.lists.TimedList.TimedList¶

Trims the list after specified offset

Parameters

  • offset – The lower bound in milliseconds

  • includeEnd – Whether to include the end

  • inplace – Whether to just modify this instance or return a modified copy

Returns

Returns a modified copy if not inplace

attribute(method: str) → List¶

Calls each obj’s method with eval. Specify method with a string.

Parameters

method – The method to call, the string must be EXACT

Returns

Returns a List of the result

before(offset: float, includeEnd: bool = False, inplace: bool = False) → reamber.base.lists.TimedList.TimedList¶

Trims the list before specified offset

Parameters

  • offset – The upper bound in milliseconds

  • includeEnd – Whether to include the end

  • inplace – Whether to just modify this instance or return a modified copy

Returns

Returns a modified copy if not inplace

between(lowerBound, upperBound, includeEnds=True, inplace: bool = False) → reamber.base.lists.TimedList.TimedList¶

Trims the list between specified bounds

Parameters

  • lowerBound – The lower bound in milliseconds

  • upperBound – The upper bound in milliseconds

  • includeEnds – Whether to include the bound ends. Use after and before if you need to only include 1 end

  • inplace – Whether to just modify this instance or return a modified copy

Returns

Returns a modified copy if not inplace

abstract data() → List¶

The method to grab the data from derived classes

df() → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

The object itself must be df-able

firstLastOffset() → Tuple[float, float]¶

Get First and Last Note Offset This is slightly faster than separately calling the singular functions since it sorts once only

firstOffset() → float¶

Get First Note Offset

instances(instanceOf: Type, inplace: bool = False) → reamber.base.lists.TimedList.TimedList¶

Gets all instances that match the instanceOf type

Parameters

  • instanceOf – The type to match

  • inplace – Whether to just modify this instance or return a modified copy

Returns

Returns a modified copy if not inplace

lastOffset() → float¶

Get Last Note Offset

offsets() → List[float]¶

Gets all offsets of the objects

sorted(reverse: bool = False, inplace: bool = False) → reamber.base.lists.TimedList.TimedList¶

Sorts the list by offset

Parameters

  • reverse – Whether to sort in reverse or not

  • inplace – Whether to just modify this instance or return a modified copy

Returns

Returns a modified copy if not inplace
